intro: Pterichis, commonly known as the sandmat, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas, particularly in the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Pterichis species are typically low-growing shrubs or herbs with small, often hairy leaves. They produce small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish or reddish in color. The genus is characterized by its succulent stems and ability to thrive in dry, sandy soils.
